args:
The Five Archdemons rage across the continent
sowing chaos and ruin, but Harle discovers a
means to stop them. Meanwhile, the apostles
debate attaining new power by overwriting their
Sigils, a process that comes at the cost of a
shortened lifespan.
The miasma is nearly to the evacuation\nsite now. Clearly we were right to move\neveryone to the landship.

As expected of a body built to contain a
demon, it's very resistant to miasma.
I can function for a good while even
while in the thick of the stuff.
But as you approach Satan, the miasma\nbecomes unbelievably dense. I don't think\nI can break through it even with this new body.
This? Oh, it's nothing. I merely fought off\nsome fiends while in the cloud.
It's not ＂nothing,＂ and I'm not about to let\nit go untreated. Now stand still while I\ndisinfect it and bandage you up...
You're very sweet, Pi, but I'm supposed\nto be the one fussing over YOU.
Ah, but it's lovely to see mother and\ndaughter as close as ever.
Harle! Er, that IS you, right?
Indeed, I am the same Harle who made\npreparations while you two groomed each\nother en route to Grams from our lodgings.
You were looking into ways to stop Satan,\nright? Did you have any luck?
Oh, indeed I have! Thanks to your help,\nI now know how we're going to get\nwithin reach of that demon's throat...
The Five Archdemons have appeared\nall across the continent!
Judging by the reports coming in,\nthe damage is already substantial.
And we can't drop everything to deal with\nthem because we still have no idea when\nSatan will wake up.

Well, if we rush out to deal with the
Archdemons now, we might be able to
catch Satan right as he's stumbling
out of bed.

We struggled to fell the Archdemons in the
Empyrean War due to their vast healing
capabilities. Theirs is not a battle that will
be quickly won.
And having Satan awaken while we are\naway dealing with the Archdemons would\nbe the worst-case scenario.
Is there any way out of this situation?
Yes. We've determined exactly how\nSatan is recovering his health.
As we all know, demons draw energy\nfrom miasma.

They use miasma to steal the contents of
the human mind and feed upon it, claiming
memories, emotions, and eventually even
a person's sanity.

That is the same way I used the miasma
issuing from the sealing stone to steal
minds and grant the Archdemons the
power they needed to revive.
And as it turns out, the same holds true\nfor Satan. He's stealing minds and turning\nthem into energy.
Some of the energy is used to create\nmore miasma and expand the radius of\nthe cloud, reaching even more minds.
It's true that the miasma grew after\nit consumed that army, but...
But those were the only minds affected,\nand yet the miasma continues to spread.\nHow do you explain this?
Just as Sigils binds us to the angels,\nso too are Satan and the Archdemons\nconnected.
We apostles draw a portion of the angels'\nstrength through the Sigils and make it\nour own.

And you think the Five Archdemons are
stealing minds and sending that energy
back to Satan through their connection?
It's a fascinating idea...
What's more, I suspect the Archdemons\nalso share a connection among\nthemselves.
If each is able to fuel the other, that would\nexplain their uncanny healing ability.
With the survivors all evacuated to the\nGran Fiore, there are no minds left to\nsteal in Grams.
Which means Satan can only absorb\nwhatever energy the Archdemons can\nsupply. Cut that supply off...
And Satan can't heal OR produce\nmore miasma!
The miasma that exists now will dissipate\nwith time. Once it thins out, we'll be able\nto get close.
Indeed! But while I wish I could take all the\ncredit, I'm afraid I'm just the messenger.
In that case, our plan is clear: First, we\nsend forces to each of the Archdemons to\nstop them from stealing any more minds.
Once the miasma thins out, the main force\ngoes in to reclaim the Sacred Shard.\nIs this acceptable?
I see one critical problem: Where will\nwe find sufficient troops to subdue the\nArchdemons?
You can start with the Watch.
We've been through a lot, but at the\nend of the day, Grams is our home.
Please allow me to participate as well.\nI will reach out to my contacts among the\nknightly orders and seek their assistance.

Grams is my home as well—and as a
wise man recently reminded me,
all lives are precious. I will not permit
the Watch to shoulder this burden alone.
The Halidom will offer everyone we can\nspare, and I'll send word across the\ncontinent to enlist more help.
All of Grastaea must join together\nto fight back this evil.
In that case, Chanzelia will deal with the\ndemon at South Grastaea's border.
And I'll inform Leonidas that Valkaheim's\naid is required as well.
We have our strategy; it's time to act.\nWe don't know when Satan will awaken,\nso time is of the essence.
Say, Pinon. Tell me more about how you\ndug up that juicy bit of intel.
Harle told me about it when we met at the\nevacuation site—under the condition that I\ndidn't mention his name to the prince.

I remember him saying something about
staying out of sight to avoid adding to the
chaos. But surely it's about time he
showed his face.
＂The time is not yet come to show myself,＂\nhe said. He seemed to still be searching\nfor something.
Oh, but he did tell me that he's looking\nforward to fighting alongside us when\nthe time is right.
He seems to bear us no hostility.\nWe should leave him to do as he will.
In that case, we focus on the task at hand.
We were a diverse group, but we moved as one.\nAnd after gathering allies for the fight against the\ndemons from across all of Grastaea...
The briefing is about to start, Basileus.\nWe're gathering on the main deck.
Wait, Pinon. A moment, if you would?

Were it not for your words, I would have
died without accomplishing anything.
You have my sincere thanks for stopping
me when you did.
Michael also told me how you said we\nshould live and atone for our actions.

When this is all over, the two of us will
accept our judgment. We do so both as
a matter of pride, and as our way of
atonement to all of you.
I hope you'll say as much to the others—\nand that you don't forget all the lives\nyou took along the way.
Though you can't bring back the dead,\nyou can offer prayers to them, as well\nas comfort to those left behind.
I never thought the day would come when\nyou would be the one to show me the\npath of righteousness.
You are no longer the rookie I once knew.\nInstead, you have become a fine apostle.
I only wish I could have heard those words\nfrom you before you decided to betray us.\nAnyway, enough. The others are waiting.
We move at dawn. When Regina sends the\nsignal to all the squads using her tablet,\nwe strike the Archdemons simultaneously.
Once the miasma surrounding Satan thins,\nthe angels, apostles, and Halidom elites\nwill advance and reclaim the Shard.
And that Shard will allow us to\nseparate Origa from Satan?
According to Zena, it should be possible.
Once Origa is free, we use the Shard to\nseal Satan in the other world once more.\nThis concludes the mission brief.
I imagine you're happy to hear there's\na way to save Origa, Regina.
Yes. And this time, I'm not letting go.\nI'll never let go again.
Though his power will be less than before,\nSatan's might is still vast. I put our odds\nof success at slightly less than 40 percent.
You know, it's fine to keep some things\nto yourself from time to time, Uriel.

Refusing to view the situation objectively
is the mark of a failure. I merely meant
to say that I would welcome a way to
improve our odds.
In that case, I have a proposition.

Though this is secret knowledge possessed
by only Metatron and myself, there is
actually an order of contractual bond
beyond your current Sigils.
Just as I am now permitted to speak of the\nmimicries, Metatron also enabled me to\noverwrite the Sigils in dire emergencies.
This higher-order Sigil will allow for\ngreater amounts of power to be shared\nbetween angel and apostle.
Including the bond Regina and I share.
Okay, so you've been holding out on some\nsecret power-up this ENTIRE time?!\n...Also, what's the catch?

There are two. First, your Sigils were made
to ensure angels did not become a force
greater than the Church could wisely use.
Bypassing that could have...consequences.

And second, the power granted by a
higher-order Sigil is beyond what most
humans can withstand, and it may well
shorten their lives.
So you want to shave years off Pi's life?!

I do not—which is why I did not propose
the matter until now. However, if we look
to enhance our capabilities for this fight,
it is an option we must consider.
If it means sealing Satan away, I suppose\nthis is no time to hold back. But still...
The decision ought fall not to the angels,\nbut instead to those who will bear the cost.\n...Apostles? What say you?
Seems like a no-brainer to me.
It doesn't matter how much shorter our\nlives are if we fail at this.
Only a fool would allow concerns of living\ntomorrow to get them killed today.
I've always been one to see my desires\nachieved by any means necessary.\nI suspect you feel the same, Regina?
Of course. Our resolve is unshakable.

This from the guy who just threw himself
in front of an attack and got blown to bits?
I think you've hogged enough of the glory
for one lifetime, my man.

We aren't asking for our Sigils to be
overwritten because we don't care about
dying. We're doing it so we get to keep
on living with all of you.
Oh, my sweet Little Pi... But very well.\nIf this is your decision, I will respect it.
Then I shall overwrite the contracts now.\nLet this new power be yours!
